instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the purpose of the SurfaceProperty:HeatBalanceSourceTerm object?
output: The object allows additional heat source term of the surface boundary condition in the surface heat balance calculation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the Field: Hydronic Tubing Conductivity specify?
output: It specifies the thermal conductivity of the pipe/tube used in the radiant system in Watts per meter-Kelvin (W/m-K).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum values for x in CoolPowCurve?
output: Minimum: -100 Maximum: 100

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Time Constant?
output: Heat Recovery Cooling Capacity Time Constant (hr)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 1 2017 rated evaporator fan power per volume flow rate?
output: The Speed 1 2017 rated evaporator fan power per volume flow rate is 453.3 W/(m3/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Fully Discharged Module Open Circuit Voltage' indicate?
output: This field indicates the open circuit voltage for a fully discharged battery module.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the relationship between EIR and COP?
output: The energy input ratio (EIR) is the inverse of the coefficient of performance (COP).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text
input: What does the Field: Initial Value contain?
output: This field contains the schedule value that is used during the system sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> listing
input: What is the tank volume for the water heater in the listing?
output: The tank volume is 0.151 m3.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the Refrigeration System Liquid Suction Subcooler Heat Transfer Energy?
output: This output is the total heat transferred from the liquid condensate before the thermal expansion valve to the suction gas.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Field: Flow Fraction Schedule Name' if left empty?
output: The default value for the 'Field: Flow Fraction Schedule Name' is 1.0 if left empty.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What happens if the PTI value is less than the minimum in the temperature equation?
output: Values of PTI less than the minimum will be replaced by this minimum when calculating the regeneration outlet air temperature and a warning message will be issued.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: What determines the operating range of the evaporative cooler?
output: The operating range is controlled based on minimum and maximum inlet node air temperature limits.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What are some example files for specifying Design Day inputs?
output: Look at the example files 1Zone-Un-controlled_DD-Changes.idf and 1Zone-Uncontrolled_DD-2009 for several examples of specifying Design Day inputs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the calculation method for the 'Zone Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner Latent Cooling Energy [J]'?
output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system timestep being simulated and the results (latent heat extraction only) are summed for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the object 'SurfaceConvectionAlgorithm:Inside:UserCurve' used for?
output: This object is used to describe a custom model equation for surface convection heat transfer coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Why might detailed descriptions of how actual units perform and are controlled not be available?
output: Detailed descriptions of how actual units perform and are controlled are not available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What additional role does the 'Storage Control Utility Demand Target' field play beyond being an upper limit?
output: It also calls for extra electric power to raise demand up to the target and put the extra power into on-site storage.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Optimum Part Load Ratio' contain?
output: This field contains the chiller's optimum part-load ratio where the chiller performs at its maximum COP.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the default value for the maximum flow fraction during reheat?
output: The default is autosize which is set to 0.002032 m³/s-m² (0.4 cfm/ft²) multiplied by the zone floor area divided by the Maximum Air Flow Rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What happens if conditions disable economizer operation?
output: The variable is set to 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What characterizes Mode 0?
output: Mode 0 is usually characterized by electricity use for controls and crankcase heaters or other standby resource consumption.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the chiller's end-use subcategory is omitted or blank?
output: The chiller will be assigned to the 'General' end-use subcategory.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What is the Pump Zone Convective Heating Rate output?
output: This output is the thermal loss from the pump to the surrounding Zone in the form of convective gains directly to the zone air. It is only available if a Zone was named in the pump input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Core length' field specify?
output: This field is the length of core embedded in the surface named above in the surface name field. In other words this should be the distance that air travels as it through the slab. The length of the hollow core in the surface should be entered in meters and is used to determine the effectiveness of heat transfer from the air being circulated through the cores and the core inside surface. Longer core lengths result in more heat transferred to/from the radiant surface to the circulating fluid.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What are typical values for the 'Blowdown Concentration Ratio'?
output: Typical values for tower operation are 3 to 5 with a default value of 3.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the function of the 'LeavingSetpointModulated' mode in the 'Field: Chiller Flow Mode' for the Chiller:Electric:ASHRAE205?
output: LeavingSetpointModulated changes the chiller model to internally vary the flow rate so that the temperature leaving the chiller matches a setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the back side beam-beam visible transmittance?
output: This value is the back side beam-beam visible transmittance of the glazing at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the Field: Control Zone Name?
output: This alpha field is the name of the control zone for this setpoint manager. This zone needs to be controlled using ZoneControl:Thermostat:StagedDualSetpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What does the Field: Vapor Diffusion Resistance Factor #x represent?
output: The Liquid Transport Coefficient of the x\(^th\) pair.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Availability Schedule Name' provide?
output: The 'Field: Availability Schedule Name' provides the name of a schedule that will determine if this fault is applicable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What happens if the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low temperature?
output: If the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below the low temperature the baseboard heater operates at the low temperature capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: When was the ideal loads system significantly expanded?
output: It was expanded in version 7.0 (October 2011).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text

output: The name of the pump is Circ Pump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the Field: Outlet Node Name represent?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the pump outlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What factors affect the beam solar transmittance through a window screen?
output: The beam solar transmittance depends on various factors including the screen reflectance and the relative angle of the incident beam with respect to the screen.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the 'Setpoint at High Reference Humidity Ratio' field?
output: The humidity ratio setpoint in humidity ratio at the high reference humidity ratio for the reset rule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What is the WaterUse:Connections object?
output: The WaterUse:Connections object can be thought of as a subsystem that groups together multiple WaterUse:Equipment components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the definition of the 'Zone Air Terminal Hot Supply Duct Damper Position' output?
output: This output is the damper position of the hot air stream in a dual duct air terminal defined as the terminal unit hot air mass flow rate divided by the terminal unit’s maximum hot air mass flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text

output: A corresponding air flow rate must be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Reference Heating Mode Leaving Condenser Water Temperature'?
output: The default value is 60.0°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

output: This field is ignored when the control type is either ZoneLoadConvective or ZoneLoadTotal.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What do hot water and steam heating coils require?
output: They require specifying plant loop branches and connector objects to support the heating coils and are placed on the demand side of the plant loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: Can the user choose to overwrite the cooling setpoint temperature?
output: Yes the user can choose whether to overwrite the cooling setpoint temperature only when the adaptive setpoint is higher than the user input one for the purpose of energy saving.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the role of a dehumidification component in conjunction with this setpoint manager?
output: A dehumidification component placed upstream of the setpoint node can use the maximum humidity ratio setpoint to control its moisture removal rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the minimum value of x for the cubic curve?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

output: The global cooling sizing factor from the Sizing:Parameters object is used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative / -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: AirTerminal:SingleDuct:ConstantVolume:Reheat -> Inputs -> text

output: The 'Field: Maximum Hot Water or Steam Flow Rate' is set to the maximum design hot water or steam volumetric flow rate in m³/s for the hot water or steam heating coil and is zero for gas and electric coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the reheat component object for Zone 2?
output: The reheat component object for Zone 2 is 'Coil:Heating:Electric'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: This numeric field defines the nominal cooling capacity for the WaterToAirHP cooling coil in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What slat angle control types does the equivalent layer window blind model allow?
output: The equivalent layer window blind model allows three slat angle control types.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: Can the Ground Reflected Solar be negative?
output: No the Ground Reflected Solar is never allowed to be negative.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: Which surfaces may not be allowed to have subsurfaces?
output: Surfaces in contact with the ground (e.g. Outside Boundary Condition = Ground) may not be allowed to have subsurfaces.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

output: The default is 2°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text

output: The pressure rise in Pascals at full flow and standard (sea level) conditions (20 °C and 101325 Pa).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Cooling Coil Electricity Energy output variable represent?
output: The output variable is the electric consumption of the heat pump in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> equation
input: What is the equation for Mixing Sensible Loss Rate?
output: Mixing Sensible Loss Rate = (Mixing Sensible Loss Rate during on cycle * Run time fraction) + Mixing Sensible Loss Rate during off cycle * (1.0 -- Run time fraction).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What must the value for the 'Field: Crankcase Heater Capacity' be?
output: The value for this input field must be greater than or equal to 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the unit for Refrigeration Air Chiller Secondary Loop Total Heat Transfer Energy?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the current EIR calculated using the 'Electric Input to Output Ratio Modifier Function of Part Load Ratio Curve Name'?
output: The output of this function and the output of the EIR Modifier Function of Temperature are multiplied by the reference EIR to get a current EIR.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the range of values for the thermal absorptance field?
output: Values must be between 0.0 and 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: What should the program manager referenced in this field include?
output: The program manager should include all the Erl programs that are to be run each time the component is simulated and use the calling point called UserDefinedComponentModel.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the Zone Radiant HVAC Pump Electricity Energy field report?
output: This field reports the electric power consumption for the pump which supplies flow to the constant flow radiant system in Joules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: Where are ground temperatures specified for SetpointManager:FollowGroundTemperature?
output: Ground temperatures are specified in different Site:GroundTemperature:* objects and used during the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text

output: This crankcase heater power is consumed to warm the refrigerant and oil when the compressor is off when the outdoor temperature is below the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature for crankcase heater operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text

output: The 'Coil:UserDefined' needs to be specifically configured in 'EnergyManagementSystem:MeteredOutputVariable' in order to be included in the meters such as HeatingCoils:EnergyTransfer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Why is the water-heater considered as a cooling coil?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: For units with water coils the model must be numerically inverted to obtain a specified output.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

output: The Ventilation Control Zone Temperature Setpoint Schedule Name specifies a schedule of zone air temperature set points that controls the opening of windows and doors in the thermal zone to provide natural ventilation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

output: It can be used to describe the physical size of the heat recovery portion of a split bundle condenser section.

input: What is the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio at Speed 8?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What happens during evaporative cooling in a refrigeration system?
output: With evaporative cooling water is sprayed through the air stream to effectively lower the air temperature experienced by the condenser coil as a result of water evaporation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for the diameter of the main pipe for Discharge Gas if the field is blank?
output: If this field is blank the default value of 0.0762m is used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> table row

output: ConstantCubic

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Construction Name field in the SurfaceProperty:HeatTransferAlgorithm:Construction object?
output: This field is the name of a Construction object defined elsewhere. All the surfaces in the model that are assigned this type of construction will be assigned to use the heat transfer algorithm selected in the previous field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: How is the latent heat addition rate calculated?
output: This value is calculated as the difference between the total energy rate and the sensible energy rate provided by the multispeed heat pump.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the VRF Heat Pump Cycling Ratio?
output: This output field is the cycling ratio of the heat pump condenser's first stage compressor defined as the fraction of time the first stage compressor is on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What is the coefficient C in the formula?
output: The coefficient C in the formula: Kc = A*Gamma**B + C + D*Gamma + E*Gamma**2.

output: Hot Water Demand Schedule

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: HVAC: Primary and Secondary Systems -> text
input: What is the starting point of the air loop supply side?
output: The air loop starts after the zone return streams are combined.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is Zone Ventilation Latent Heat Loss Energy?
output: Zone Ventilation Latent Heat Loss Energy is the latent heat loss that occurs when the ventilation air humidity ratio (outdoor) is less than the zone air humidity ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> listing

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text

output: The design minimum exhaust temperature is 150°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: See Figure~\\reffig:modulation-of-venting-area-according-to.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the suggested value for the nominal time for condensate removal?
output: The suggested value for the nominal time is 1000; a zero value means the latent degradation model is disabled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What does the 'Field Set (Optical Data Temperature Window Material Glazing Name)' describe?
output: This object is extensible so additional sets of the next two fields can be added to the end of this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What are the possible inputs for the 'Control Type' field?
output: The possible inputs are StayOff MaximumofZoneList and ControlZone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: How can the storage charging cycle be ended?
output: Use an AvailabilityManager:LowTemperatureTurnOff to shut off the primary chilled water loop when the temperature leaving the storage tank nears the charging mode chiller setpoint indicating that the tank is fully charged.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: How is the Convergence Tolerance field used in controlling the coil?
output: The Convergence Tolerance field sets a termination criterion for an iterative solution to determine the correct mass flow rate for the hot water coil with a default value of 0.001.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> equation
input: How is the heating Thermal Energy Input to the chiller computed?
output: The heating Thermal Energy Input to the chiller is computed as: TheoreticalFuelUse = \\fracBoilerLoadNominalThermalEfficiency

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: How are the values of inlet air wet-bulb temperature and water mass flow rate ratio handled?
output: For inlet air wet-bulb temperature and water mass flow rate ratio the values of these variables used in the calculation of approach temperature are limited to be within the valid minimum/maximum range specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: Why should the schedule be set to a value greater than 1.0 when a fault is applicable?
output: Because the fan pressure rise in the faulty case is higher than that in the design case.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the first step mentioned in the text for selecting input?
output: Select Dimensionless.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Total Cooling Capacity Function of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name for Speed 10?
output: The Total Cooling Capacity Function of Air Flow Fraction Curve Name for Speed 10 is 'TC VS AirFrac Test'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens if the Number of Surface Vertex groups is left blank or entered as autocalculate?
output: If the Number of Surface Vertex groups is left blank or entered as autocalculate EnergyPlus looks at the number of groups entered and figures out how many coordinate groups are entered.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Supply Fan Outlet Node Name' field?
output: This field is a node name used to identify the node that serves as the outlet (air side) of the supply fan for the zone outdoor air unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Evaporation Loss Mode' field determine?
output: This field is used to choose which method is used to model the amount of water evaporated by the cooling tower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What does the reference evaporating temperature for the indoor unit define when VRF runs at cooling mode?
output: It defines the reference evaporating temperature for the indoor unit when VRF runs at cooling mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> paragraph
input: What does the output 'Zone Air Terminal Outdoor Air Volume Flow Rate' represent?
output: This output represents the amount of outdoor air entering the zone defined as the terminal unit air volume flow rate multiplied by the fraction of outdoor air entering the air loop's outdoor air system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What should the volumetric flow rate match?
output: The volumetric flow rate should match the flow rate specified for the unitary system fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What are the default diffuser slot angles for different diffuser types?
output: For swirl diffusers it is 28 degrees for variable area diffusers 45 degrees for DV diffusers 73 degrees and for linear bar grilles 15 degrees.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Charge Only Mode Storage Charge Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name' field specify?
output: This field is the name of a separate performance curve object that parameterizes the variation of the storage charging capacity as a function of the drybulb temperature of the air entering the condenser section and the state of TES tank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Field: Availability Schedule Name define?
output: Schedule that defines when the coil is available. If the schedule's value is 0.0 then the coil is not available and flow will not be requested. If the schedule's value is > 0.0 (usually 1 is used) the coil is available. If this field is blank the schedule has values of 1 for all time periods. Schedule values must be >= 0 and <= 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> Section: Curve:Linear -> Inputs -> text
input: What does 'Field: Coefficient2 x' represent?
output: The linear coefficient (C_2) in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: How is Eu_max calculated for a specified fan?
output: Eu_max is calculated using any pair of pressure rise and airflow values that correspond with maximum fan static efficiency for the specified fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Ice Storage Type' specify?
output: This alpha field specifies the type of ice storage tank to be modeled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: What must the node be listed in for the 'Primary Air Inlet Node Name' field?
output: This node must be the name of a HVAC system node that is listed in a zone splitter (ref. AirLoopHVAC:ZoneSplitter).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the Cover Long-Wavelength Radiation Factor field modify?
output: This input field can optionally be used to modify the pool long-wavelength radiation rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens to the Humidistat control type if the unit is in deadband mode?
output: If the unit is in deadband mode control type Humidistat will be active.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the average total heating rate for space hot water equipment?
output: ZoneAverageSpace Hot Water Equipment Total Heating Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the Door:Interzone object used for?
output: The Door:Interzone object is used to place opaque doors on surfaces that can have doors including interzone walls and interzone ceiling/floors.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is considered if the window has a frame?
output: The absorption of reflected beam solar by the inside and outside surfaces of the frame is considered.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the system's supply air fan operating mode is continuous and the No Load Outdoor Air Flow Rate is set to zero or left blank?
output: The model assumes that the no load outdoor air flow rate is equal to the outdoor air flow rate when the coils were last operating and this field is not used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What information does the field 'Pipe Density' provide?
output: This numeric field is the pipe density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Carbon Dioxide Generation Rate' field and what does it assume?
output: The default value of 0.0 assumes the equipment is fully vented to outdoors.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the fan total efficiency for the fan system model?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: What does one of the outputs for the plant loop indicate?
output: One output is for the point where the fluid leaves the supply side and enters the demand side.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What do non-zero schedule values mean for the supply air fan?
output: Non-zero schedule values mean that the supply air fan will operate continuously even if there is no cooling or heating load in the control zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> item
input: What is the unit of the System Node Temperature?
output: The unit of the System Node Temperature is degrees Celsius (C).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Equipment <x> Cooling Sequence' field specify?
output: Specifies the zone equipment simulation order when the zone thermostat requests cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: What is the purpose of this node in relation to the setpoint schedule?
output: This node is used with the setpoint schedule defined in the following field to provide an added layer of thermostatic control for the UTSC without affecting the control of auxiliary heating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What does the Supply Water Storage Tank Name field reference?
output: Reference to the WaterUse:Storage object that supplies cold water to the listed WaterUse:Equipment objects. If the field is blank or the tank is empty fresh water is supplied from the water mains.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What does Mode06 offer in the Override Modes?
output: Mode06 offers an alternative method to calculate saturated temperature given pressure in replacement of the psychrometric function PsyTsatFnPb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the 'Zone Hybrid Unitary HVAC Zone Sensible Cooling Rate' calculated?
output: It is calculated as the difference between the enthalpy of dry air at the temperature of the return air and the enthalpy of dry air at the temperature of the supply air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What example is provided to illustrate the use of the PerformancePrecisionTradeoffs object?
output: An example using an IDF file with 100 zones one window per zone and is served by fan coil units and a central boiler and chiller.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: Is the 'Supply Inlet Water Storage Tank Name' field mandatory?
output: This field is optional.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Various HVAC Components
input: What is the sixty-third component listed in the table?
output: HVACTemplate:Zone:VAV

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the role of a dehumidification component in this context?
output: A dehumidification component such as desiccant dehumidifiers placed upstream of the setpoint node can use the maximum humidity ratio setpoint to control its moisture removal rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What happens if the user does not enter a fraction for airflow?
output: The calculated flow rate is the 'zone cooltower volume flow rate'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Control -> text
input: What control type should the heat pump model inputs set?
output: The heat pump model inputs need to set the Control Type to Setpoint control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: Can the information from one ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:VariableFlow:Design object be shared with several ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:VariableFlow objects?
output: Yes the information from one ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:VariableFlow:Design object can be shared with several ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:VariableFlow objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: When does the heat pump compressor cycle off?
output: The heat pump compressor cycles off when the tank water reaches the set point temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does a schedule value less than or equal to 0 indicate?
output: A value less than or equal to 0 (usually 0 is used) denotes that the component must be off for the time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: What is the status of the 'Field: Limit Step Change'?
output: NOT YET IMPLEMENTED.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What weather information is required for the cooltower model?
output: This model requires weather information obtained from either design day or weather file specifications.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: This output is also added to a meter with Resource Type = EnergyTransfer End Use Key = Refrigeration Group Key = Plant (Ref. Output:Meter objects).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What key should be entered for ventilation rates based on current occupancy?
output: Enter the key 'CurrentOccupancy' for ventilation rates based on current occupancy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What does selecting 'yes' for the 'Field: Constant Internal Vapor Transfer Coefficient' do?
output: Selecting 'yes' for the 'Field: Constant Internal Vapor Transfer Coefficient' uses the value supplied as the internal vapor transfer coefficient.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What are the key choice options for the Wind Convection Windward Vertical Wall Equation Source?
output: The key choice options include: SimpleCombined TARPWindward MoWiTTWindward DOE2Windward NusseltJurges McAdams Mitchell Blocken Emmel or UserCurve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is created if there is a match for the Construction Name?
output: If there is a match a window construction and its corresponding glass and gas materials will be created from the information read from the file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does the View Factor <#> field specify?
output: This field specifies the view factor from the duct to the surface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the Inputs section?
output: The name of an air distribution system node. This node name is referenced by an AirflowNetwork:Distribution:Linkage and in the output listing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Design Objects and Their Parameters
input: What is the maximum air flow rate parameter associated with AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:HeatAndCool:NoReheat?
output: Maximum Air Flow Rate

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Cooling And Discharge Mode Cooling Rated COP field specify?
output: This field specifies the coefficient of performance (COP) at rating conditions while operating in Cooling And Discharge Mode to cool air at the evaporator.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens if the tank cannot provide all the water the condenser needs?
output: The unit will still operate and obtains the rest of the water it needs from the mains (referred to as Starved Water).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the 'No Load Supply Air Flow Rate' is set to zero or left blank?
output: If the furnace operating mode is specified as continuous fan operation and this value is set to zero or this field is left blank then the model assumes that the supply air flow rate when no cooling/heating is needed is equal to the supply air flow rate when the compressor was last operating (for cooling operation or heating operation).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> listing
input: How would an 'Output:PreprocessorMessage' appear in the output?
output: Preprocessor = \No Preprocessor Used\ has the following Information messages: Illustrative Message No problems for processing

input: What does the 'Gross Rated Total Cooling Capacity at Selected Nominal Speed Level' field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the gross rated total cooling capacity at the nominal speed level. This field is autosizable.

input: What is the EvapotranspirationGroundCoverParameter?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What should one refer to for more technical details of the two VRF models?
output: Please refer to the engineering reference for more technical details of the two models.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Fluid Properties -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: User Defined Glycol Name'?
output: The 'Field: User Defined Glycol Name' is used to define your own glycol properties in a FluidProperties:Name object and it is left blank unless 'UserDefinedGlycolType' is entered in the previous field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the performance of all chiller coils depend upon?
output: The performance of all chiller coils depends upon the inlet air temperature relative humidity and flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the 'ZoneSumRefrigeration Case Zone Latent Energy'?
output: It is the sum of latent energy of the refrigeration case zone in Joules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What variable represents the outlet temperature on the load side of a heat pump?
output: HVACAverageHeat Pump Load Side Outlet Temperature [°C]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'SpaceHVAC:ZoneEquipmentMixer' object do?
output: The SpaceHVAC:ZoneEquipmentMixer object mixes the airflow from one or more Spaces into a piece of zone equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: The surface (walls and ceilings) thermal transmittance (in W/m²-K). This value has a default value of 0.3154.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Field: Name in the EnergyManagementSystem:Program object?
output: The Field: Name is the unique name of the Erl program. The name can be used to call the program to run from another program or subroutine.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

output: This alpha (choice) field defines the placement of the fan in the heat pump water heater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What happens if the Surface Name or Radiant Surface Group Name field is a surface list?
output: If this field is a surface list then the source or sink is attached to all of the surfaces in the list with the radiant system surface group defining the breakdown of how flow rate is split between the various surfaces.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What happens in Fixed mode for inlet fluid?
output: The fluid enters at the fixed heights specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: The names of the actual people objects may be concatenated as <Space Name> <People Object Name>.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What does a value of 0 indicate for the Availability Manager Night Ventilation Control Status?
output: A value of 0 indicates the manager is signaling NoAction.

output: It should only be used when the Source Side Fluid Name is an antifreeze.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What do the variables in the equation \\( \\dot m = C_TC\\left( \\Delta P \\right)^n \\) represent?
output: \\(\\dot m\\) = Air mass flow rate through the component [kg/s] C = Air mass flow coefficient (kg/s at 1 Pa pressure difference) \\(\\Delta P\\) = Total pressure loss across the element [Pa] n = Air mass flow exponent \\(C_T\\) = Temperature correction factor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the typical relationship between the air inlet node and zone outlet node in an outdoor air unit?
output: The air inlet node of the system will typically be the same node as a zone outlet node.

input: What is the value constraint for 'Back Side Shade Beam-Diffuse Solar Reflectance'?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Non-Zone Equipment -> text
