input: What is the sixth row of the example table for data ordering?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: When is the 'Source Temperature' field used?
output: If the Temperature Specification Type field is Constant then the value in this field is used as the source temperature (in C) throughout the entire simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> callout
input: How are heat transfer surfaces represented?
output: Heat transfer surfaces are fully represented with each description including materials in the construction (outside to inside) but not film coefficients which are calculated during the EnergyPlus run.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Minimum Part Load Ratio' represent?
output: A positive fraction that represents the minimum heating output possible when operated continually at partial load conditions divided by the available heating capacity at those same conditions. The default is 0.1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Name' used for in the quadratic curve?
output: A user assigned unique name for an instance of a quadratic curve. When a curve is used it is referenced by this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the Field: Design Entering Air Temperature specify?
output: This numeric field contains entering air dry-bulb temperature at nominal conditions in degrees Celsius. This field must be specified for both the performance input methods. The design entering air temperature must be greater than the design entering air wet-bulb temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the output field 'Unitary System Total Cooling Rate' represent?
output: This output field is the total (enthalpy) heat extraction rate of the multispeed heat pump from the zones it is serving in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What was published in the 2022 version of AHRI 340-360?
output: A newer definition for calculating EER IEER SEER2 and Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity was published.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Where can one find a detailed description of the algorithm and how the curves are used in calculations?
output: A detailed description of the algorithm and how the curves are used in the calculations can be found in the Engineering Reference.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: How can a user configure the dispatch of supply side equipment?
output: The user can configure exactly how supply side equipment is dispatched to meet loads by writing EnergyPlus Runtime Language programs and using the EMS features.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is contained in the 'Maximum Receiving Temperature Schedule Name' field?
output: This alpha field contains the name of a schedule (ref. Schedule objects) which contains the maximum receiving zone or space temperature (in Celsius) above which mixing is shutoff as a function of time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Cooling Water Outlet Node Name' field contain?
output: It contains the name of the cold water outlet node to the radiant system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: Why does the frequency of reporting need to be at the highest level for the Zone Air Terminal Current Operation Control Stage field?
output: Because averaging integers across more than one system timestep makes them meaningless.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What was the older investigation's recommendation for the minimum number of warmup days?
output: Older investigations indicated that 6 warmup days were generally enough on the minimum end of the spectrum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What does 'FlowPerCoolingCapacity' mean in the context of the 'Cooling Design Air Flow Method'?
output: 'FlowPerCoolingCapacity' means the supply air volume is calculated from user specified flow per cooling capacity and design cooling capacity determined by the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What does the SetpointManager:MultiZone:Humidity:Minimum do?
output: This setpoint manager allows for controlling the minimum humidity level in multiple zones served by a central forced air HVAC system (air loop).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is the latent cooling output of the cooling coil of the ventilated slab system measured in?
output: It is measured in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> text
input: When is standby power consumed?
output: This amount of power will be consumed whenever the unit is available (as defined by the availability schedule).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What are the independent variables of the energy input ratio (EIR) modifier curve (function of temperature)?
output: The independent variables are the wet-bulb temperature of the air entering the cooling coil and the dry-bulb temperature of the air entering the air-cooled condenser coil (wet-bulb temperature if modeling an evaporative-cooled condenser).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: When do the availability managers determine the operation of the fan in a WatertoAirHeatPump object?
output: If the WatertoAirHeatPump is available (per the Availability Schedule Name input field) and this input field has a valid availability manager assignment list name then the availability managers in the list determine when and if the fan of this WatertoAirHeatPump object should be on or off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Relief Air Outlet Node Name' field?
output: The 'Relief Air Outlet Node Name' field specifies the name of the relief air node of the outdoor air mixer associated with this outdoor air controller.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the Earth Tube Air Flow Volume?
output: The volume flow of air through the earth tube.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the purpose of the look up table in the inverter model?
output: The look up table is used to interpolate efficiency in the inverter model.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is required if the user specifies a U-Factor Times Area Value or Free Convection Capacity greater than zero?
output: The free convection air flow rate must be specified greater than 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How is the 'Maximum Efficiency' value used?
output: This value will be used as a limit on the curve's result.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: Under what conditions does the coil perform in Base Operating Mode only?
output: When load sensible heat ratio (SHR) is greater than the SHR in the Base Operating Mode at given inlet air conditions the coil performs in Base Operating Mode only.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> table: Table Data
input: What is the seventh row of the table?
output: \\textttiv1[2] & \\textttiv2[2] & \\textttiv3[2] & \\textttout[2][2][2]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

output: If the maximum heating design flow rate calculated using these input fields is greater than the design heating flow rate calculated during sizing these input fields have no impact on sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What are the required inputs for the water cooled condenser?
output: The inlet and outlet node names as well as the water outlet temperature schedule name are required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

output: These objects work when control option \MultiZone with Distribution\ or \MultiZone with Distribution Only During Fan Operation\ is defined in the AirflowNetwork Control field in the AirflowNetwork:SimulationControl object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the 'Treat Weather as Actual' field determine?
output: It determines how stringent date matching between this object and the weather file is.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What happens if the optimized condenser entering water setpoint is above the maximum allowed value?
output: The condenser entering water setpoint is reset to equal the maximum allowed value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Space Name' link to?
output: The 'Field: Space Name' links the equipment list back to the heat balance for the space.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the Electric Load Center Drawn Electricity Rate?
output: This output is the power fed from the main distribution panel into the load center in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the Site:GroundTemperature:Undisturbed:KusudaAchenbach provide?
output: It provides an undisturbed ground temperature based on the correlation developed by Kusuda T. and P. Achenbach 1965.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the reference for entering the pleated section average width and length?
output: The pleated section average width and length is referenced in Figure~\\reffig:geometry-used-for-pleated-drape-analysis.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What happens if a schedule is specified and zone air flow balance is enforced?
output: EnergyPlus throws a warning error message ignores the schedule and simulation continues.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: Does EnergyPlus model partially translucent glass?
output: No EnergyPlus does not model the partially translucent case where beam solar radiation incident on the glass is transmitted as a combination of beam and diffuse.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: When is the field for the supply air temperature used?
output: This field is only used when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method = SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Hybrid Model -> text
input: What is the schedule name for the zone measured air temperature in the second hybrid model?
output: Zone Measured Air Temperature Schedule Name

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What are the outputs related to Zone Infiltration Current Density Volume and Volume Flow Rate?
output: These outputs are the total volume and volume flow rate of infiltration air based on the current density of zone air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the Surface Window Screen and Glazing System Beam Solar Transmittance?
output: It is the fraction of exterior beam solar radiation incident on an exterior window with a screen (excluding window frame if present) that is transmitted through the screen/glass system as beam solar radiation. It depends on various factors including the screen reflectance and the relative angle of the incident beam with respect to the screen.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is reported to the eio file when autosizing?
output: The maximum and the individual inlet flow rate sizes are reported to the eio file when autosizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Fluid Properties -> text
input: What do the fields 1-250 represent in the superheated region?
output: These fields (up to 250) are the values of the thermal property specified in the fluid property type field for the phase specified in the fluid phase field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Surface Inside Face Convection Classification Index
input: What is the zone airflow regime for code 10?
output: A2 Radiant Wall Heat

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' input?
output: A unique identifying name for each coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Cooling Coil Object Type' field define?
output: This alpha field defines the type of DX cooling coil used by this PTAC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What happens if RFV is greater than the maximum value?
output: Values of RFV greater than the maximum will be replaced by this maximum value when calculating the regeneration outlet air temperature and a warning message will be issued.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How does the size of the 'Heating Convergence Tolerance' parameter affect control?
output: The relative size of this parameter relates directly to the closeness of the control. A very small value will result in tight control and probably larger numbers of iterations while a large value will result in looser controls and could result in unsatisfactory fluctuations in zone air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does each numeric field in the 'Field: Month Temperature(s) -- 12 fields in all' represent?
output: Each numeric field is the monthly ground temperature (degrees Celsius) used for the indicated month.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the CPU end-use subcategory for the given equipment?
output: The CPU end-use subcategory is ITE-CPU.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does the effective leakage area (ELA) object define?
output: The effective leakage area (ELA) object is used to define surface air leakage.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Pump Flow Rate Schedule Name' do?
output: The schedule values modify the value for Rated Flow Rate of the pump on a time basis.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How should the curve in 'Field: Electrical Power Function of Temperature and Elevation Curve Name' be normalized?
output: This curve should be normalized to have a value of 1.0 at the reference conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Inputs -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Angle Factor <#>' represent?
output: The 'Field: Angle Factor <#>' represents the fraction that this surface contributes to the total mean radiant temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How can you deploy different shading devices during different time periods for the same window?
output: Specify two different WindowShadingControl objects that both reference the same fenestration each with different schedule input objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: Where can the 'Occupant Ventilation Control' object be assigned?
output: It can be assigned to a zone (AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Zone) or a surface (AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: When is the 'Nameplate Efficiency' field used?
output: This field is used only if the field of Performance Input Method is specified as NominalEfficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is specified by the 'Supply Air Fan Name' field?
output: This field is the name of a fan that is part of the unit heater system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the 'Tank Volume' field specify?
output: The volume of the thermal storage tank [m³].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> listing
input: What is an example of the input for a Scheduled Setpoint Manager?
output: SetpointManager:Scheduled  Supply Air Temp Manager 1  !- Name  Temperature                !- Control Variable  Seasonal Reset Supply Air Temp Sch  !- Schedule Name  VAV Sys 1 Outlet Node;      !- Setpoint Node or NodeList Name

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What happens when optional inputs are provided to the Mixed Air Setpoint Manager?
output: When optional inputs of Cooling Coil Inlet Node Name Cooling Coil Outlet Node Name and Minimum Temperature at Cooling Coil Outlet Node are provided the setpoint temperature at the mixed air node is calculated based on the maximum of both the reference setpoint temperature and minimum cooling coil outlet temperature minus the cooling coil air temperature reduction and the supply fan air temperature rise if the supply fan placement is blow through.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the water consumption for the use side if in stand-alone operation?
output: Water Heater Water Volume [m³]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the reported value for the system on cycle?
output: The reported value is for the system on cycle.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the heat pump condensing unit is off and the outdoor temperature is below the maximum?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What do the terms in the Speed Ratio equation using desired outlet temperature represent?
output: SpeedRatio = Ratio to represent how long the higher speed runs as a fraction of the system timestep and the lower speed runs in the rest of the system timestep; DesOutTemp = Desired outlet temperature to meet setpoint; OutTempFull_i = Outlet temperature of full output at the higher speed; OutTempFull_i-1 = Outlet temperature of full output at the lower speed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What are the two potential ways to use other side coefficients?
output: Either they are used to set the temperature of the exterior side surface directly (if the combined convective/radiative coefficient is less than or equal to zero) or to set both the film coefficient (positive value for the combined convective/radiative coefficient) and the outside air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> equation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

The heating rate is determined by the zone conditions the control scheme defined in the user input and the timestep.

input: What is the case anti-sweat heater power per unit length in W/m?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the 'Chiller Heater Heating Part Load Ratio' calculated?
output: This is the average heating load (Chiller Heater Heating Rate [W]) divided by the average available heating capacity (Chiller Heater Heating Rate [W]) for the reported time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Hybrid Model -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: The gross rated total cooling capacity is used to determine a capacity scaling factor as compared to the Reference Unit capacity at the nominal speed level.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What is the Zone Ventilated Slab Coil Sensible Cooling Rate?
output: This field reports the sensible cooling output rate of the cooling coil of the ventilated slab system to the zone it is serving in Watts. This is determined by outlet and zone air conditions and the mass flow rate through the ventilation slab system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: How is the Zone Mixing Latent Heat Gain Energy calculated?
output: The latent heat transfer is the sum of all the incoming air mass flow rates multiplied by the elapsed time the heat of vaporization (calculated for the average conditions (temperature and humidity) between the source and receiving zones) and the humidity ratio differences between the host zone and corresponding source zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What is the Economizer Maximum Limit Dewpoint Temperature field used for?
output: Input for this field is the outdoor air dewpoint limit (°C) for economizer operation. If the outdoor air dewpoint temperature is above this value the outdoor airflow rate will be set to the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

This output is positive when enthalpy is added to the zone otherwise it is zero. This output is an average rate over the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What does the Field: Severity Schedule Name provide in the FaultModel:TemperatureSensorOffset:ReturnAir?
output: This field provides the name of a schedule that represents severity of a fault. This is used as a multiplier to the user-defined temperature offset. This schedule should be set to a non-zero value when a fault is applicable and 0.0 when it is not. If this field is blank the schedule has values of 1 for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> equation
input: What equation is used to account for altitude in the supply air flow rate?
output: The equation is: p = 101325*(1-2.25577E-05*Z)**5.2559 where p = pressure in Pa and Z = altitude in m.

input: What does 'Site Beam Solar Radiation Luminous Efficacy' measure?
output: A measure of the visible light content of beam solar radiation; equal to the number of lumens per watt of beam solar radiation. Depends on atmospheric conditions (moisture turbidity cloudiness) and solar altitude.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What happens if the field for deep layer penetration depth is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank or set to autocalculate the equation will be used to calculate the deep layer penetration depth assuming a \(\tau_deep\) of three weeks.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What assumption is made about the distribution of windows on the shading surface?
output: It is assumed that the windows are evenly distributed over the surface and have the same glazing construction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the purpose of the field 'Evaporator Air Outlet Node Name'?
output: This field is the name of an HVAC system node that the coil sends its outlet air. It is for the evaporator's connection to the air system but may include other air cooling devices in series with the evaporator.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What is the purpose of the setpoint managers in the context of outlet temperature and/or humidity ratio?
output: The purpose is to specify the outlet temperature and/or humidity ratio and set the outlet conditions from the coil to meet these setpoints.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the result of the curve multiplied by in the 'Cooling Only Mode Sensible Heat Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name' field?
output: The result of the curve is multiplied by the Cooling Only Mode Rated Sensible Heat Ratio to model the SHR at coil entering temperatures that differ from the rating point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is the window or door control determined in 'ASHRAE55Adaptive' mode?
output: The openable window or door associated with this surface is opened if the operative temperature is greater than the comfort temperature (central line) calculated from the ASHRAE Standard 55-2010 adaptive comfort model and Venting Availability Schedule allows venting.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> table row: Values for ``Terrain

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When is the basin heater active?
output: The basin heater is active when the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature falls below this setpoint temperature as long as the DX coil is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What are the options for the Deep-Ground Boundary Condition?
output: The options for the Deep-Ground Boundary Condition are ZeroFlux GroundWater and Autoselect.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How many performance curves are required for the VRF DX heating coil and what do they define?
output: Two performance curves are required. The first performance curve defines the heating capacity as a function of indoor air dry-bulb and outdoor condenser entering air dry-bulb or wet-bulb temperature. The second performance curve defines the change in heating capacity as a function of air flow fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What happens to blank fields in the Matrix:TwoDimension?
output: Blank fields are treated as having been set to zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What should be referred to for more details about specifying applicable zones or spaces?
output: See Specifying Applicable Zone(s) or Space(s) for more details.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the 'Heat Gain Coefficient from Ambient Temperature' field?
output: The gain coefficient [W/K] from the ambient air temperature. This coefficient is often referred to as the 'UA' for the overall tank thermal performance with respect to heat gains from the tank's skin.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the zone infiltration mass?
output: HVACSumZone Infiltration Mass [kg]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: It identifies a single case or walk-in or a particular list of refrigerated cases and walk-ins that are cooled by this refrigeration secondary system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> list item

output: FACADE4 represents west orientation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text

output: The wind speed modifier allows the user to adjust openness when the AirflowNetwork opening objects are selected.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

output: The chiller is typically thought of as capable of being overloaded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text

output: Figure 134 depicts the Two-Tank Solar Heating System with Tempering Valve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text

output: A humidifier component placed upstream of the setpoint node can then use the humidity ratio setpoint to control its moisture addition rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: What do the ventilation flow output variables report?
output: The fresh air flow into each zone is reported using the ventilation flow output variables. The total outdoor air flow in a primary air system is divided to each zone based on the fraction of flow each zone is supplied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: How is this unit modeled in EnergyPlus?
output: This unit is modeled in EnergyPlus as a compound component: a variable speed fan and a heating coil in series in the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

output: The minimum zone cooling volumetric flow rate per square meter is expressed in units of m³/s-m².

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text

output: The Bifacial PV Workshop was held in Lakewood Colorado.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text

output: Plant Supply Side Cooling Demand Rate should not be summed over time because it will overstate the demand whenever the loop is off setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: It is a key/choice field that tells which of the next three fields are filled and is descriptive of the method for calculating the nominal electric equipment level in the Zone or Space.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text

output: It measures the total daylight illuminance at the first reference point from all of the windows in a daylit zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What is the minimum regeneration inlet air humidity ratio for the Humidity Ratio Equation?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: Recovery efficiencies higher than 30% may cause the refrigerant gas to condense which in turn impacts the performance of the refrigeration system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> list item

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: The 'Field: Name' specifies the name of the HotWaterEquipment object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text

output: No surfaces with 'Ground' exposure do not use the 'outside' coefficient.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does the 'Maximum Indoor Temperature Schedule Name' field define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of a schedule which contains the maximum indoor temperature (in Celsius) above which ventilation is shutoff as a function of time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Sizing Factor' field allow the user to do?
output: This optional numeric field allows the user to specify a sizing factor for this component.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

output: This field is the Y coordinate (in meters).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is required of the condenser name?
output: The condenser name must be unique and will be validated against all the condenser names in the input file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: According to which standard are SEER2 User SEER2 Standard EER IEER and Standard Rating (Net) Cooling Capacity calculated for cooling capacity less than 65000 Btu/hr?
output: They are calculated according to ANSI/AHRI standard 210-240 (2023).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What should be entered in the 'Field: Condensate Collection Water Storage Tank Name' to collect condensate?
output: Enter the name of a WaterUse:Storage object defined elsewhere and the condensate will then be collected in that tank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is an example of a district cooling statement in an IDF?
output: DistrictCooling Purchased Cooling      NODE_35NODE_49      68000;

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the total heating energy for space hot water equipment?
output: ZoneSumSpace Hot Water Equipment Total Heating Energy [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: How often are the shadowing calculations done by default throughout a weather run period?
output: By default the calculations are done for every 20 days throughout a weather run period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What does the object 'FaultModel:TemperatureSensorOffset:CoilSupplyAir' define?
output: This object defines the operational fault of supply air temperature sensor offset for the coils with temperature-based control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the default COP if the input is left blank?
output: If this input is left blank the default is 3.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the performance curve normalized?
output: The performance curve is normalized to have a value of 1.0 at the rating point which is defined to be x = 19.4°C y = 26.7°C and z = 0.5 for Ice storage type or z = Fluid Storage Tank Rating Temperature when storage type is Water or UserDefinedFluidType.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the field 'Per Unit Load for Maximum Efficiency' define?
output: This field defines the percentage of the rated capacity at which the maximum efficiency is obtained.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: Are the values for 'CondFD Phase Change Previous State' the same as for 'CondFD Phase Change State'?
output: Yes the values for this output are the same as for the output CondFD Phase Change State above.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Source Side Flow Control Mode' field?
output: This field is optional and is used to provide control over the logic used by the source side of the water heater to request flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What determines the operating characteristics of the crankcase heater in a VRF system?
output: The operating characteristics of the crankcase heater are determined exclusively by the VRF system condensing unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> listing
input: What is the name of the multi-speed heating DX coil?
output: The name of the multi-speed heating DX coil is Heat Pump DX Heating Coil 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What must be specified for each heating speed in the 'Rated specification and performance curves' field group?
output: The performance for each heating speed must be specified as shown below. They should be directly given from the Reference Unit data.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is electric energy consumption modeled at temperatures away from the rating point?
output: The result of this curve is multiplied by the inverse of the Cooling And Charge Mode Charging Rated COP to model electric energy consumption at temperatures away from the rating point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 1 Waste Heat Function of Temperature Curve Name?
output: wasteHeat VS Temp1 Test

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Name' in the Chiller:ConstantCOP model represent?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the constant COP chiller.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Why is the coil regarded as a cooling coil?
output: The coil draws heating energy from air to the heater thus it is regarded as a cooling coil as shown in the output variable names.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the role of the IDF Editor in relation to the 'Input Unit Type for y'?
output: It is used by IDF Editor to display the appropriate SI and IP units for the Minimum Value of y and Maximum Value of y.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Case Defrost Power per Unit Length' field if the field is blank?
output: The default value is 0 W/m if the field is blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'DrawThrough' choice mean?
output: The 'DrawThrough' choice means that the unit consists of an outdoor air mixer followed by a DX coil followed by a fan. The fan 'draws air through' the coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: EnergyManagementSystem:Sensor -> Inputs -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Output:Variable or Output:Meter Index Key Name'?
output: The key reference for the specified output variable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> equation
input: What is the simple equation to obtain typical values for a surface that is not shadowed?
output: View Factor to Ground = (1-cos(SurfTilt))/2

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens if the mixed air humidity ratio is greater than the target humidity ratio for the Humidistat option?
output: If the mixed air humidity ratio is greater than the target humidity ratio then the mixed air humidity ratio will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is assumed about the outside reveal surfaces?
output: The outside reveal surfaces (top bottom left right) have the same solar absorptance and depth.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the range of values for the 'Field: Fraction of Condenser Pump Heat to Water'?
output: Values must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> equation
input: What is the defining equation for the Fuel Input Curve?
output: ExhaustFlowRate = GTCapacity * (C_1 + C_2AT_air + C_3AT_air^2)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is assumed about the coils in the sizing calculations?
output: The coils are assumed to deliver the various supply temperatures specified in the Sizing:System and Sizing:Zone objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What type of schedules are ideal for defrost scheduling purposes?
output: The use of Compact Schedules (ref. Schedules) are ideal for this purpose.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'System Outdoor Air Method' field?
output: The method used to calculate the system minimum outdoor air flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: How are slats assumed to transmit and reflect in the 'WindowMaterial:Blind:EquivalentLayer' object?
output: Slats are assumed to transmit and reflect diffusely.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the EIR at specific temperature operating conditions calculated?
output: The output of the curve is multiplied by the rated EIR (inverse of the rated COP) to give the EIR at specific temperature operating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the 'Pump Flow Rate Schedule Name' field modify?
output: The schedule values modify the value for Rated Flow Rate of the pump on a time basis.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> equation
input: What is the formula for Mixing Sensible Loss Rate?
output: Mixing Sensible Loss Rate = (Mixing Sensible Loss Rate during on cycle * Run time fraction) + Mixing Sensible Loss Rate during off cycle * (1.0 -- Run time fraction)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

This is determined by the current heat gain from the heater to the zone and the 'Fraction Radiant' specified in the input. The radiant gains (long wavelength) are distributed to the surfaces using an area weighting scheme.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: How is the sensible heat transfer due to mixing calculated?
output: The sensible heat transfer due to mixing is the sum of all the incoming air mass flow rates multiplied by the elapsed time the specific heat (calculated for the average conditions between the 'source' and 'receiving' zones) and the temperature differences between the host zone and corresponding source zones. Negative heat transfer is considered a zone mixing sensible heat loss while positive heat transfer is a zone mixing sensible heat gain.

Since window screens are typically installed against the window frame the default value is equal to 0. This input value can range from 0 to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: Does the presence of an exhaust fan drive any simple airflow?
output: No the presence of an exhaust fan does not by itself drive any simple airflow such as infiltration ventilation or zone mixing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the default value for Deep-Ground Depth?
output: The default value is 40 m or the distance determined by the 'Autoselect Deep-Ground Boundary Condition'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What factors affect the appropriate threshold temperature?
output: The appropriate threshold temperature varies with exhaust (inlet) air temperature and humidity frost control type heat exchanger type and whether the heat exchanger transfers sensible energy alone or both sensible and latent energy (enthalpy).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is checked when the input is retrieved regarding battery voltage during charging and discharging?
output: The voltage during charging at a particular battery charge should be higher for charging. If not it could lead to results showing more energy being discharged by the battery than was charged.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the relationship between the damper air outlet node and the reheat coil?
output: The damper air outlet node is the outlet node of the damper and the inlet node of the reheat coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What happens to specified objects when the fan is OFF in 'MultiZoneWithDistributionOnlyDuringFanOperation'?
output: Any ZoneInfiltration:* ZoneVentilation:* ZoneMixing and ZoneCrossMixing objects specified in the input data file are used when the HVAC system fan is OFF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the result of the first step in the adjustment process?
output: This step will always result in balanced zone air mass for receiving zones of ZoneMixing object but may not necessarily result in a balanced air mass flow for source zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the water volume of the starved storage tank in a cooling tower?
output: Cooling Tower Starved Storage Tank Water Volume [m3]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What happens if the voltage during charging is not higher than during discharging?
output: It would potentially lead to results that show more energy being discharged by the battery than was charged and warning messages are produced to alert the user.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: HVACAverage Refrigeration Air Chiller System Suction Temperature [C]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: When does the basin heater operate?
output: The basin heater operates when the condenser fan is off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> listing
input: Provide an example of an IDF for 'AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:HeatAndCool:Reheat'.
output:
An IDF example is provided as follows:
AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:HeatAndCool:Reheat
Zone 1 VAV System       !- Name of System
FanAndCoilAvailSched     !- System Availability schedule
Zone 1 Reheat Air Inlet Node !- DAMPER Air Outlet Node
Zone 1 VAV Inlet Node     !- UNIT Air Inlet Node
0.583             !- Maximum air flow rate m3/s
0.25             !- Zone Minimum Air Flow Fraction
Coil:Heating:Electric     !- Reheat Component Object
Reheat Coil Zone 1      !- Name of Reheat Component
0.0              !- Max Reheat Water Flow m3/s
0.0              !- Min Reheat Water Flow m3/s
Zone 1 Reheat Air Outlet Node !- UNIT Air Outlet Node
0.001;             !- Convergence Tolerance
Coil:Heating:Electric
Reheat Coil Zone 1      !- Coil Name
FanAndCoilAvailSched     !- Availability Schedule Name

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the Zone Ideal Loads Heat Recovery Latent Cooling Energy?
output: The latent cooling energy (or rate) removed from the outdoor air stream from heat recovery.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What are typical values for the constant \\(C\\) in the equation for \\(\\Delta x\\)?
output: Typical values are from 1 to 3.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How does the 'Fraction Latent' field affect energy calculations?
output: The number specified in this field will be multiplied by the total energy consumed by gas equipment to give the amount of latent energy produced by the gas equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What will happen if the supply air flow fields are not specified as autosizable when required?
output: A fatal error will be issued and the simulation will terminate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text

input: How is the performance of the HeatPump:WaterToWater:EquationFit:Cooling model modeled?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: This input field should be left blank when the WaterToAirHeatPump is connected to an AirTerminal:SingleDuct:Mixer object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: At what part-load ratio does the chiller-heater perform at its maximum COP?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Sizing Factor' field allow the user to specify?
output: This optional numeric field allows the user to specify a sizing factor for this component.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What happens when the ZoneList option is used?
output: The thermostat definition is applied to each of the zones in the zone list effecting a global definition for thermostatic control in the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens when the outdoor air temperature or post-supply fan outlet temperature is above the high air control temperature?
output: A cooling coil if available and specified by the user is turned on to condition the outdoor air to the high control temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What must be input if NominalCapacity is chosen?
output: If NominalCapacity is chosen the user must input a Rated Capacity for the coil; UA of the Coil and Max Water FlowRate of the Coil will be ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the air flow rate determined if Condenser Type is AirCooled or EvaporativelyCooled and Heat Recovery is specified?
output: If AirCooled or EvaporativelyCooled and this field is autosized the air flow rate is set to 0.000114 m3/s/W (850 cfm/ton) multiplied by the chiller Reference Capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in GasEquipment?
output: The name of the GasEquipment object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Key choice and application

output: Outside

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
