output: The Rated Capacity field specifies the nominal full output water addition rate of the unit in m³/sec of water at 5.05 C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: How is the screen-to-glass distance used?
output: The screen-to-glass distance is used in calculating the natural convective air flow between the glass and the screen produced by buoyancy effects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What should the condenser type be to model secondary DX coils?
output: To model secondary DX coils the condenser type should be AirCooled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Surface Category Codes
input: What does the code 13 represent in the table?
output: The code 13 represents an A2 Radiant Wall Heat with a tilted surface and stable heat flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the DewpointMethod define?
output: The DewpointMethod defines the variation in defrost energy as a cubic function of ambient (zone) air dewpoint temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: Where are the sizing factors and averaging window size reported?
output: The sizing factors and the averaging window size are reported in the 'eplusout.eio' file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> table
input: What is the source side design flow rate?
output: autosize

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the operational value range for the unitary system when cycling on and off its lowest speed?
output: The value is between 0.0 and 1.0 when the unitary system is cycling on and off its lowest speed (Speed 1) and 1.0 when the unitary system operates at speeds above 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Input Unit Type for x'?
output: This field is used to indicate the kind of units that may be associated with the x values. It is used by IDF Editor to display the appropriate SI and IP units for the Minimum Value of x and Maximum Value of x. The unit conversion is not applied to the coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What are the outputs for the Chiller Heater System Source Inlet Temperature?
output: The outputs are the source water inlet and outlet temperatures and flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What does the Field: Zone Name specify in the UCSD Displacement Ventilation Model Controls object?
output: This field provides the unique name of a zone described elsewhere in the file. A single instance of the UCSD Displacement Ventilation Model Controls object is needed for each zone that is to be modeled using this method.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What does the object allow the user to define regarding outdoor air flow rate?
output: The object allows the user to define the minimum outdoor air flow rate based on air flow per unit floor area and air flow per person (occupant) for the zones being served by the air loop that utilizes this controller.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is an example of how the flow rate to the system will be set?
output: In this example it is assumed that heating control temperature setpoint is currently 15°C the heating throttling range is 2°C and that the setpoint type is HalfFlowPower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How are adiabatic surfaces modeled?
output: Adiabatic surfaces are modeled by specifying the base surface itself in this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the electric power for Zone-Baseboard:Outdoor-Temperature-Controlled objects within the space or zone?
output: This field is the electric power for all Zone-Baseboard:Outdoor-Temperature-Controlled objects within the space or zone in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the name of the third air terminal?
output: Zone3DirectAir

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative / -> equation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Maximum Zone Temperature when Heating' field?
output: This is the indoor temperature above which the earth tube is shut off to avoid overheating a space.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Low Fan Speed Fan Power Sizing Factor' field specify?
output: This numeric field contains the sizing factor for calculating the low fan speed fan power as a fraction of the high fan speed fan power. The default is 0.16.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Minimum Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature for Compressor Operation' field define?
output: It defines the minimum outdoor air dry-bulb temperature where the cooling coil compressor turns off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the numeric field labeled 'Coefficient 2 of Fuel Use Function of Part Load Ratio Curve' contain?
output: This numeric field contains the fuel use / PLR coefficient2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: When is the user-defined operation scheme's calling manager triggered?
output: The user defined operation scheme will trigger this calling manager at the beginning of each new environment period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> text
input: What function does the parent object (Dehumidifier:Desiccant:System) provide?
output: The parent object (Dehumidifier:Desiccant:System) itself provides the 'controller function of modulating water flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table: Design Objects
input: What is the speed 4 rated evaporative condenser pump power consumption for the Coil:Cooling:DX:MultiSpeed?
output: Speed 4 Rated Evaporative Condenser Pump Power Consumption

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text

output: The choices for Initialization Type are LinearInitializationMethod and ZeroNodePressures with the default being ZeroNodePressures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: Where is the outdoor air temperature obtained from during simulation?
output: The outdoor air temperature is obtained from the weather information during the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: The rated air volume flow rate should be between 0.00004027 m³/s and 0.00006041 m³/s per watt of the gross rated total cooling capacity.

input: What is the Rated Condenser Water Temperature?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How can interzone heat transfer to an attic space be modeled?
output: The ceiling in the lower zone must have a surface object with the outside face environment as the floor in the attic and likewise there must be a floor surface object in the attic that references the ceiling surface name in the lower zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What does the \\emphVFD Efficiency Curve Name field determine?
output: The \\emphVFD Efficiency Curve Name field determines the VFD efficiency \\(\\eta_VFD(x_VFD)\\) as a function of the fractional input power of the motor or fractional motor speed \\(x_VFD\\).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Name' identify?
output: The 'Field: Name' identifies a particular condenser that rejects heat for a single refrigeration system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is venting controlled at the ZoneLevel?
output: Venting of the window or door is not controlled individually but is controlled instead at the zone level. This means that the venting is determined by the AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Zone object for the thermal zone containing the window or door.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What does the 'Water System Storage Tank Mains Water Volume' output represent?
output: This is the volume of water drawn from the mains in order to fill the tank in units of cubic meters per second (m³/s). This output is also added to a meter with Resource Type = MainsWater End Use Key = WaterSystem and Group Key = System. The water quality sub-category may be entered as any type (defined in WaterUse:Storage object input for Water Quality Subcategory).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does 'LeavingSetpointModulated' do?
output: 'LeavingSetpointModulated' changes the chiller model to internally vary the flow rate so that the temperature leaving the chiller matches a setpoint.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What are the key/choices available for the 'Design Level Calculation Method' field?
output: The key/choices are: EquipmentLevel Watts/Area or Power/Area Watts/Person or Power/Person.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What are the two discharge options for the ice storage tank?
output: There are two discharge (melt) options internal or external.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: Is the 'Field: Supply Air Outlet Node Name' required for passive beams?
output: Yes the name of this node must be entered even if the actual beams are passive and is not actually supplying air to the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Generator Operation Scheme Type' specify in EnergyPlus?
output: This alpha field specifies the type of operating scheme for the generator set.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: How is the 'Name of Ventilated Slab Surface Group' used?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text

output: Mode06 offers an alternative method to calculate saturated temperature given pressure in replacement of the psychrometric function PsyTsatFnPb.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the method 'HeatingDesignCapacity' mean?
output: HeatingDesignCapacity means user specifies the magnitude of maximum or nominal heating capacity or the program calculates the maximum or nominal design heating capacity if autosize is specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

input: What does the 'Efficiency' field specify?

output: The alpha field 'Controlling Zone or Thermostat Location' contains the identifying zone name where the thermostat controlling the multispeed heat pump is located.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: The number specified in this field will be multiplied by the total energy consumed by gas equipment to give the amount of heat which is 'lost' and does not impact the zone energy balances.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What information does the 'Constant Part of Electromechanical Power Losses' field provide?
output: This numeric field contains the estimated parameter power loss which accounts for the loss of work due mechanical and electrical losses in the compressor in Watts.

output: The Integral-Collector-Storage (ICS) solar collector model simulates glazed collectors with integral storage unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What do the variables in the air flow equation represent?
output: Q = air mass flow (kg/s) C_Q = air mass flow coefficient (kg/s-Pa^n @ 1 Pa) C_T = reference condition temperature correction factor (dimensionless) ΔP = pressure difference across crack (Pa) n = air flow exponent (dimensionless).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What does the 'Pipe Outer Diameter' field specify?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What happens if the maximum receiving temperature is not greater than or equal to the minimum receiving temperature?
output: Warnings will be issued and the maximum shutoff temperature will be set to the minimum shutoff temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What conditions are assumed for the free convection capacity of the cooling tower?
output: Entering water at 35C (95F) leaving water at 29.4C (85F) entering air at 25.6C (78F) wetbulb and 35C (95F) drybulb temperatures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> listing

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the field 'Thermosiphon Minimum Temperature Difference' specify?
output: It specifies the minimum temperature difference to activate refrigerant thermosiphoning. If the temperature difference is less than this value refrigerant thermosiphoning is disabled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What common practice does the 'Module Charge Rate Limit' reflect?

output: A Connector:Splitter is used to take a single fluid stream or branch and split it into more than one outlet branches.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

output: This field determines the position of this point in the direction perpendicular to the main direction of heat transfer with a dimensionless value ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What does the 'Air System Outdoor Air Economizer Status' report?
output: It reports the average operating status of an air economizer over the reporting interval. The economizer status is set to 1 when conditions are favorable for the economizer to operate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: How is the amount of outdoor air defined?
output: The amount of outdoor air is defined as the terminal unit air volume flow rate multiplied by the fraction of outdoor air entering the air loop's outside air system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> equation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: When is the Chiller:ConstantCOP model useful?
output: Such a model is useful when the user does not have access to detailed performance data.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the field 'Maximum Number of People' define?
output: This field defines the maximum occupancy of people actually in the pool and thus will be used with the next two inputs to determine how much heat people contribute to the pool heat balance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: IDD Conventions -> text
input: What is the conversion factor from m3/s-W to (ft3/min)/(Btu/h)?
output: The conversion factor from m3/s-W to (ft3/min)/(Btu/h) is 621.099127332943.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: How is the actual induced outdoor airflow rate in a zone for a particular simulation time step defined?
output: It is defined as the product of the Induced Outdoor Air Due to Unbalanced Duct Leakage input field and the value specified by the schedule named in this input field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Free Convection Regime Air Flow Rate' describe?
output: This numeric field contains the air flow rate (m³/s) when the tower is in the 'free convection' regime (water flow exists but tower fan is turned off).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Hybrid Model -> text
input: What additional schedules are needed to calculate the zone air infiltration rate with the HVAC on for moisture balance?
output: The Zone Measured Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name Zone Input Supply Air Mass Flow Rate Schedule Name and Zone Input Supply Air Humidity Ratio Schedule Name are needed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens if the 'Outdoor Air Mixer Object Type' field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank an outdoor air mixer object is not simulated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What is the 'Use Side Inlet Node Name'?
output: The inlet node connection to the plant loop for the use side of the water heater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text

output: The Surface Type field must be specified as TubularDaylightDome or TubularDaylightDiffuser accordingly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the PLR in the Fuel Input equation?
output: PLR is the Ratio of Generator Load to Rated Power Output.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

input: How many vertices are there in the SouthZone 1st Floor ceiling?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

output: Infiltration flow will be increased or decreased to balance the net flow from supply exhaust mixing and return air flows.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is calculated when the supply air fan is cycling between consecutive speed levels?
output: When the supply air fan is cycling between consecutive speeds levels the speed ratio is calculated that indicates what fraction of the time step the system runs at the higher of the two speeds.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the 'Part Load Fraction Correlation Curve Name' field?
output: This alpha field defines the name of a quadratic or cubic performance curve that parameterizes the variation of electrical power input to the dehumidifier as a function of the part load ratio (PLR). The part load fraction (PLF) correlation accounts for efficiency losses due to compressor cycling. The part load fraction correlation should be normalized to a value of 1.0 when the part load ratio equals 1.0. For PLR values between 0 and 1 the following rules apply: 0.7 <= PLF <= 1.0 and PLF >= PLR.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text

input: What are 'Peak Operation' and 'Off Peak Operation' in the first IDF example?
output: 'Peak Operation' and 'Off Peak Operation' are the names of two different load range based controls defined separately.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> equation
input: How is the Infiltration Latent Loss calculated?
output: Infiltration Latent Loss = (Infiltration Latent Gain Loss during on cycle * Run time fraction) + Infiltration Latent Loss during off cycle * (1.0 -- Run time fraction)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 10 Energy Input Ratio Function of Water Flow Fraction Curve Name?
output: EIRH VS WaterFrac Test

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does TCEnt_required represent?
output: TCEnt_required is the required entering condenser air or water temperature to maintain rated capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: How is the control of the electric baseboard heater accomplished?
output: The control is accomplished by taking the remaining zone load and dividing by the efficiency of the baseboard.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Generator Inlet Node Name' field contain?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name given to the Generator Inlet Node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: When does the reheat coil operate when Damper Heating Action is set to Normal?
output: The reheat coil operates only when the damper is at this minimum flow rate when Damper Heating Action is set to Normal (the default).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What happens if the control temperature is above the high temperature in a radiant heating system?
output: If the control temperature is above the high temperature then the system will be turned off and the water mass flow rate will be zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What must the user define for fluid cooler performance?
output: The user must define fluid cooler performance via one of three methods: design heat transfer coefficient-area product (UA) and design water flow rate or standard fluid cooler design capacity at a specific rating point or design capacity at non standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the type of energy measured for Other Equipment Fuel?
output: Energy [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Economizer Maximum Limit Enthalpy field?
output: The purpose of this field is to set the outdoor air enthalpy limit for economizer operation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the source of the BLAST defaults?
output: The source of the BLAST defaults is noted in the BLAST documentation as: 'Empirical equation and the coefficient default were determined from ASHRAE journal articles and other data on the effects of outdoor weather conditions.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: When is the Ambient Temperature Schedule Name used?
output: Schedule name for ambient temperature when the previous field is Schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group ExternalInterface -> text
input: What is the ExternalInterface:Variable used for?
output: This input object is similar to EnergyManagementSystem:GlobalVariable and is used to set its value to the value received from the external interface during time stepping.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What components make up a packaged terminal heat pump (PTHP)?
output: Each PTHP consists of an outdoor air mixer direct expansion (DX) cooling coil DX heating coil supply air fan and a supplemental heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What happens when the water heater tank set point temperature is greater than the cut-in temperature of the heat pump compressor?
output: The heat pump compressor is disabled and the tank's heater is used to heat the water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Maximum Secondary Air Flow Rate' describe?
output: The maximum volumetric air flow rate of secondary air through the unit in cubic meters per second. This flow rate can be any amount but is commonly less than the maximum primary air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: How many deep ground temperature objects can be included?
output: Only one deep ground temperature object can be included.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the 'Air Inlet Node Name' field contain?
output: This alpha field contains the name of the node from which the heat pump water heater draws its inlet air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Design Inlet Air Dry-Bulb Temperature' field specify?
output: This numeric field specifies the design inlet air dry-bulb temperature of the tower. The default is 35.0°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does the output variable 'AFN Linkage Node 1 to 2 Average Mass Flow Rate [kg/s]' represent?
output: This is the AirflowNetwork linkage average mass flow rate in kg/s in the direction from Node 1 to Node 2 defined in the AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: What happens when the schedule value is 0 for the solar collector?
output: When the schedule value is 0 the collector will be bypassed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the function of the part load fraction correlation (function of part load ratio)?
output: The part load fraction correlation (function of part load ratio) is a quadratic or cubic curve with the independent variable being part load ratio (sensible heating load / steady-state heating capacity).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: When does the reheat coil operate according to the 'Constant Minimum Air Flow Fraction' field?
output: The reheat coil operates only when the damper is at the minimum flow rate when Damper Heating Action is set to Normal.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the 'End-Use Subcategory' field allow?
output: The 'End-Use Subcategory' field allows the specification of a user-defined end-use subcategory (e.g. 'Low Temperature Rack').

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What object is included in the sizing factor?
output: The sizing factor includes the Sizing:Parameters object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the Sensible Heat Ratio Modifier Function of Temperature Curve Name?
output: Three Speed SHR fTemp Spd 3

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What are the two choices available for cooling capacity control?
output: The two choices are FanCycling and FluidBypass.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What happens in the 'MinimalShadowing' case?
output: In this case there is no exterior shadowing except from window and door reveals. All beam solar radiation entering the zone is assumed to fall on the floor where it is absorbed according to the floor's solar absorptance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens when blinds screens and shades are 'on'?
output: When the device is 'on' it is assumed to cover all of the window except its frame.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the purpose of specifying a user-defined end-use subcategory for fan power consumption?
output: This field allows you to specify a user-defined end-use subcategory for the fan power consumption and a new meter for reporting is created for each unique subcategory.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What indicates that the unit must be off?
output: A value less than or equal to 0 (usually 0 is used) denotes that the unit must be off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Fields: Heating Capacity Curve Name' specify?
output: This alpha field specifies the name of a quadlinear performance curve object (ref: Performance Curves) for the Heating Capacity curve. More details on how these coefficients in the curve are used are described in the Engineering Reference.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Using EnergyPlus as a Library -> text
input: Why is it convenient that the energyplus function expects arguments like the EnergyPlus(.exe) program?
output: This is a convenience because the energyplus function expects arguments just like the EnergyPlus(.exe) program so the test script would have the same command line capabilities as EnergyPlus itself.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the base operating mode in the context of a Coil:Cooling:DX:CurveFit:OperatingMode object?
output: The base operating mode is the name corresponding to a Coil:Cooling:DX:CurveFit:OperatingMode object and is always used as the base design operating mode. This field is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Name' allow in 'SizingPeriod:WeatherFileConditionType'?
output: This field allows for an assigned name for this run period so it can be tracked easily in sizing and other outputs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does a value of 1 indicate for the 'Unitary System DX Coil Speed Level'?
output: When the value is 1 the heat pump operates at Speed 1 (lowest speed). For this case the cycling ratio is between 0.0 and 1.0 while the speed ratio is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What does the example at the end of the section illustrate?
output: The example illustrates a complete zone thermal comfort control specification including the control type and setpoint schedules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is not required for autosizing the design air flow rate field?
output: Autosizing of this field does not require a Plant Sizing object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What does the 'Secondary Air Inlet Node Name' field specify?
output: The name of the HVAC system node from which the unit draws its secondary inlet air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is described in detail below in the text?
output: Each of the AirflowNetwork distribution component and linkage object types.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the first list of the refrigeration system include?
output: The first list includes all cases and walkins cooled directly by this system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the output of the 'Speed <x> Total Cooling Capacity Function of Temperature Curve' used?
output: The output of this curve is multiplied by the gross rated total cooling capacity at the speed to give the gross total cooling capacity at specific temperature operating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the Field: Chilled Water Inlet Node Name represent for Chiller:Absorption?
output: This required alpha field contains the identifying name for the absorption chiller plant side inlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does Figure 73 depict?
output: Figure 73 depicts the Schematic of Four-Pipe Air-to-Water Heat Pump with Heat Recovery.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> enumerate item
input: What is the independent variable for the heating capacity modifier curve (function of flow fraction)?
output: The independent variable is the ratio of the actual air flow rate across the heating coil to the rated air flow rate (i.e. fraction of full load flow).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What is 'Site Exterior Horizontal Beam Illuminance'?
output: Beam illuminance on an unobstructed horizontal plane at the earth's surface. Equals 'Site Exterior Beam Normal Illuminance times sine of solar altitude.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens for an interior wall separating two zones?
output: Zone x would have the outside layer (e.g. drywall) as the material that shows in zone y and then the layers to the inside layer -- the material that shows in zone x.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the maximum value for the Carbon Dioxide Generation Rate field?
output: The maximum value for this input field is 3.45E-7 m3/s-W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Normalization Reference Value' is left blank?
output: No normalization will be calculated and the Normalization Reference Value of all other Table:IndependentVariable objects within the same Table:IndependentVariableList must also be left blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What occurs if the Control Object Type field is left blank in the schedule?
output: The schedule has a value of 1 for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Heating Coil Heating Energy [J] field represent?
output: This is the total heating output of the DX coil in Joules over the time step being reported determined by the coil inlet and outlet air conditions and the air mass flow rate through the coil. This output is also added to a meter with Resource Type = EnergyTransfer End Use Key = HeatingCoils Group Key = System.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What type of values does the schedule need to have?
output: This schedule needs to have integer values that are closely coordinated with those defined as the second field in one of the RoomAir:TemperaturePattern:* objects described below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: Under what names will all output variables be shown?
output: All output variables will be shown under surface names only and not under zone names.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Fraction Radiant' field specify?
output: This field specifies what fraction of the power input to the baseboard heater is actually transferred to the space as radiant heat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: Is the 'Transcritical-Compressor-Capacity-Curve-Name' field required if Transcritical is selected as the Mode of Operation?
output: Yes if Transcritical is selected as the Mode of Operation then this input field is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What are the options for the 'Evaporation Loss Mode' field?
output: There are two options: LossFactor or SaturatedExit. The default is SaturatedExit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the field 'Outdoor Air Mixer Object Type' specify?
output: This field specifies the type of outdoor air mixer used by this PTHP.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What are the choices for the field 'Dedicated Outdoor Air System Control Strategy'?
output: The choices are NeutralSupplyAir NeutralDehumidifiedSupplyAir or ColdSupplyAir.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What does the zone level cooling sizing ratio input affect?
output: The zone design cooling air flow rates and loads will be multiplied by the number input in this field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the baseboard radiant heating energy report?
output: This field reports the amount of radiant energy transferred from the baseboard to the zone in Joules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How does the fan operate in the case of an OnOff fan?
output: The fan cycles with the heating coil if the current timestep supply fan operating mode schedule value is 0 or else if the schedule value is greater than 0 then the supply fan runs continuously for the entire timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: When do the air distribution system simulation objects work?
output: These objects work when control option 'MultiZone with Distribution' or 'MultiZone with Distribution Only During Fan Operation' is defined in the AirflowNetwork Control field in the AirflowNetwork:SimulationControl object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What is shown in Figure 125?
output: Figure 125 shows the Variable Refrigerant Flow Schematic.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Soil Material Name' reference?
output: The 'Field: Soil Material Name' references a Material object that contains the soil properties and thickness specifying the thickness of soil between the pipe wall and the ground surface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> table row: Curve:Biquadratic
input: What is the Output Unit Type for MinSpdCooling?
output: Dimensionless

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How is the radiant heat from equipment absorbed in a space or zone?
output: This heat is absorbed by the inside surfaces of the space or zone according to an area times long-wave absorptance weighting scheme.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: When is the 'Cooling Design Capacity Per Floor Area' field required?
output: This field is required when the Cooling Design Capacity Method is 'CapacityPerFloorArea'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the output field for the heat extract rate of the VRF outdoor unit evaporator?
output: This output field is the heat extract rate of the VRF outdoor unit evaporator in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: How does the SimulationControl input allow permutations of run selection?
output: The SimulationControl input allows all permutations of run selection by means of 5 yes/no inputs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Zone VRF Air Terminal Fan Availability Status' output field represent?
output: This is the availability status of the Zone Terminal Unit fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: IDD Conventions -> text
input: What is the conversion factor from lux to foot-candles?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What does the 'Coefficient3 x**2' field represent?
output: The coefficient C_3 in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the 'Space or Zone ITE Fan Electricity Energy'?
output: It is the total electricity energy consumed by the fan in joules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What should be referenced for the Z-Direction Mesh Density Parameter?
output: See Field: X-Direction Mesh Density Parameter.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: When is the 'Fraction of Autosized Heating Design Capacity' field required?
output: This input field is required when the Heating Design Capacity Method is FractionOfAutosizedHeatingCapacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> listing
input: What is one of the outputs listed related to sensible cooling rate?
output: One of the outputs listed is 'HVACAverageZone Hybrid Unitary HVAC System Sensible Cooling Rate [W]'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is the default value for the Fan Sizing Factor if the field is blank?
output: The default value is 1.0 if the field is blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does a positive 'Condensation Control Dewpoint Offset' parameter indicate?
output: The radiant system will shut down or increase the inlet water temperature when the surface is the number of degrees Celsius above the dew-point temperature providing extra safety to avoid condensation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What happens if the field for the Mode # System Water Use Lookup Table Name is blank?
output: If this field is blank Mode # does not consume water.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the field 'Voltage Change Curve Name for Discharging' specify?
output: This field specifies the name of a rectangular hyperbola type 2 performance curve that determines the change of open circuit voltage as a function of the battery state of charge in discharging.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What does the Heat Exchanger Electricity Rate output indicate?
output: This output is the average electric consumption rate of the unit in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: Are ASHRAE 55 comfort warnings generated by default?
output: No these warnings will not be generated by default.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: When will Mode 0 be chosen?
output: Mode 0 will be chosen for any timestep or portion of timestep when the unit is available but there is no sensible load latent load or scheduled ventilation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Diffuser Name' refer to?
output: It refers to a FenestrationSurface:Detailed object with Surface Type TubularDaylightDiffuser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for 'Condenser Flow Control'?
output: The default is 'ConstantFlow'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: What does the 'Loop Circulation Time' field specify?
output: The 'Loop Circulation Time' field specifies the time it takes the fluid to circulate through the entire loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: How does the flow rate to the radiant system vary with temperature?
output: For example if the cooling control temperature setpoint is currently 25 C and the cooling throttling range is 2 C the water flow rate to the radiant system will be zero when the controlling temperature is at or below 24 C and the maximum flow rate when the controlling temperature is at or above 26 C. In between 24 C and 26 C the flow rate to the radiant system is varied linearly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Exterior Energy Use Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: End-Use Subcategory' is omitted or blank?
output: If this field is omitted or blank the equipment will be assigned to the 'General' end-use subcategory.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the Cooling Coil Upper Speed Level?
output: The upper speed level of the DX coil. Used for interpolating performance between two neighboring speed levels.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> table
input: What is the heater 1 setpoint temperature schedule name?
output: Plant Hot Water Setpoint Temp Schedule

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What are the two purposes of the AvailabilityManager:HybridVentilation?
output: 1) prevents simultaneous natural ventilation and HVAC system operation and 2) allows users to examine various ventilation strategies to maximize natural ventilation in order to reduce heating/cooling loads.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> table: ElectricEquipment:ITE:AirCooled Air Inlet Limiting Temperature and Humidity Levels
input: What is the minimum dew-point temperature for Environmental Class A3?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the SpaceList object primarily used for?
output: The SpaceList object is primarily used with Internal Gains objects (People Lights etc.) to apply the same gain across a group of Spaces.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Speed <x> Reference Unit Rated Condenser Air Flow Rate' field for an evaporatively-cooled condenser?
output: This field is used to calculate water evaporation rate for an evaporatively-cooled condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What are the input objects required to model a detailed transcritical CO2 refrigeration system?
output: The input objects required include: One Refrigeration:TranscriticalSystem object at least one refrigeration load object which may include any combination of Refrigeration:Case Refrigeration:WalkIn and Refrigeration:CaseAndWalkInList (may include both cases and/or walk-in cooler names).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> list item
input: What is the output variable for the HVACSum related to Electric Storage Charge Energy?
output: Electric Storage Charge Energy [J]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum setpoint humidity ratios?
output: The minimum setpoint humidity ratio is 0.003 kgWater/kgDryAir and the maximum setpoint humidity ratio is 0.012 kgWater/kgDryAir.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What is the purpose of the ReportDuringWarmup key?
output: ReportDuringWarmup allows reporting during warmup days which can show how the facility is converging during the initial warmup days of the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is the reference pressure difference defined?
output: The reference pressure difference is defined as the difference between pressures of originate and terminate nodes for supply and return leaks.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the unit for 'Window Transmitted Diffuse Solar Radiation Energy'?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What does the pipe segment object document?
output: This section documents the pipe segment object which is used to specify information for a single pipe segment placed at some x y.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the benefit of using translucent glazing in a zone with Daylighting:Detailed?
output: Translucent glazing provides a more uniform daylight illuminance over the zone and avoids patches of sunlight on the floor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the outdoor unit evaporating temperature function of superheating curve name?
output: OUEvapTempCurve

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> item
input: What is the unit of the System Node Specific Heat?
output: The unit of the System Node Specific Heat is Joules per kilogram-Kelvin (J/kg-K).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: How are main-level programs executed in EnergyPlus?
output: Within each program there may be calls to execute subroutine programs but only calling managers are used to execute main-level programs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: How is the amount of outdoor air defined?
output: The amount of outdoor air is defined as the terminal unit air volume flow rate multiplied by the fraction of outdoor air entering the air loop's outside air system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative / -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the input section?
output: This field is a unique user assigned name for an instance of a hydronic low temperature radiant system. Any reference to this unit by another object will use this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: How does the API Callback method for user-defined component models differ from the Python Plugin method?
output: This approach is very similar to the Python Plugin in that the user will still create the user-defined behavior in Python. However in this case the user will create a callback function for modeling the behavior and register the function using the runtime API function callback_user_defined_component_model.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Defrost Time Period Fraction'?
output: The default value for the 'Defrost Time Period Fraction' is 0.058333.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: What should the program manager referenced in the 'Main Model Program Calling Manager Name' field include?
output: The program manager referenced here should include all the Erl programs that are to be run each time the component is simulated and use the calling point called UserDefinedComponentModel.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is unusual about this type of chiller in EnergyPlus?
output: This type of chiller is unusual for EnergyPlus because it may be used in the same plant on both a chilled water supply branch and a hot water supply branch.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the name of the material?
output: Material:RoofVegetation

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the field 'Heating Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name' specify?
output: This alpha field specifies the name of a biquadratic or cubic performance curve object that defines the variation in DX coil heating capacity as a function of inlet fluid (air and water) temperatures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the rated air volume flow rate range for the single speed heating DX coil?
output: It should be between 0.00004027 m3/s and 0.00006041 m3/s per watt of gross rated heating capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Cooling Coil Source Side Outlet Temperature [C]' output variable represent?
output: The output variable is the average leaving water temperature over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What does the input for a quadratic curve consist of?
output: Input for a quadratic curve consists of the curve name the three coefficients and the maximum and minimum valid independent variable values.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Source Side Heat Transfer Resistance2' field define?
output: This numeric field defines the estimated parameter source side heat transfer resistance 2. Unit is W/K.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the field 'Month that Storm Glass Layer Is Taken Off' used for?
output: The field 'Month that Storm Glass Layer Is Taken Off' is used to specify the number of the month during which the storm window is removed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> listing
input: What is the heating supply air flow rate operation for the ZoneHVAC:PackagedTerminalAirConditioner?
output: Autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What are 'Shading' surfaces used for?
output: 'Shading' surfaces describe site aspects that may shade the building during specific times but do not impact environmental parameters directly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> table: Outputs
input: What is the unit for Zone Ideal Loads Outdoor Air Latent Cooling Energy?
output: Joules (J)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: What is shown in the Air Loop input syntax diagram?
output: A map for Air Loop input syntax is shown in the diagram.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Heat Pump Sizing Method'?
output: The default value is CoolingCapacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What versions of reports are available for the heat storage outputs?
output: Different versions of the reports are available including the basic heat storage rate (W) a per unit area flux (W/m²) directed 'gain' and 'loss' versions and a version for total energy stored (J).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 6 Reference Unit Gross Rated Heating COP?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: How can heating be controlled in a Series PIU Terminal Unit with a variable speed fan?
output: Heating can be either staged or modulated with different heating controls as diagrammed below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: Where will the setpoint be stored for the SingleSetpoint scheme?
output: The setpoint will be stored in the Node%TempSetpoint variable which may be reported using Output:Variable 'System Node Setpoint Temperature.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What must the maximum receiving temperature be in relation to the minimum receiving temperature?
output: The maximum receiving temperature when mixing is shutoff must be greater than or equal to the minimum receiving temperature when mixing is shutoff at any given time.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
