input: What is the purpose of the Wall:Underground object?
output: The Wall:Underground object is used to describe walls with ground contact. The temperature at the outside of the wall is the temperature in the GroundTemperature:BuildingSurface object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: How is the DemandManagerAssignmentList object structured?
output: The DemandManagerAssignmentList object is structured like the relationship between the AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList and the AvailabilityManager objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Heating Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name' field define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of a bi-quadratic quadratic or cubic performance curve for Speed <x> (ref: Performance Curves) that parameterizes the variation of the total heating capacity as a function of both the indoor and outdoor air dry-bulb temperature or just the outdoor air dry-bulb temperature depending on the type of curve selected.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the 'Nominal Time for Condensate Removal to Begin' field used for?
output: It specifies the nominal time (in seconds) after startup for condensate to begin leaving the coil's condensate drain line at the coil's rated airflow and temperature conditions starting with a dry coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the Field: Heat Exchanger Setpoint Node Name specify?
output: It specifies the name of a plant system node located on loop attached to the Loop Supply Side.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> table row: Table:IndependentVariableList
input: What are the values for iv1 iv2 and iv3 in the nineteenth row of the table?
output: The values are iv1[3] iv2[1] iv3[3] and the output is out[3][1][3].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Output Unit Type'?
output: This optional field is provided for future purposes so that the IDF Editor could display the appropriate SI or IP units for the Minimum Curve Output and Maximum Curve Output (currently dimensionless). At this time only the \\textbfDimensionless option is provided so that no unit conversion is used for this curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the cooling capacity for the cooling only mode determined?
output: The cooling capacity for the cooling only mode is sized to meet the air system's final design cooling capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does a zero value mean for the 'Maximum Cycling Rate'?
output: A zero value means the latent degradation model is disabled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the unit for the Evaporation Loss Factor?
output: The unit is percent-per-kelvin.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What do the Zone Outdoor Air Unit Sensible Heating Energy [J] and Zone Outdoor Air Unit Sensible Heating Rate [W] fields represent?
output: These are the sensible heating output rate of the outdoor air unit system to the zone it is serving in Joules or Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Input Unit Type for X' field?
output: This field is used to indicate the kind of units that may be associated with the x values. It is used by IDF Editor to display the appropriate SI and IP units for the Minimum Value of X and Maximum Value of x. The unit conversion is not applied to the coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> table row: Operating Conditions for Defining Heat Exchanger Performance
input: What are the entering supply air wet-bulb temperatures for heating and cooling conditions?
output: The entering supply air wet-bulb temperatures are 0.6°C (33°F) for heating and 26°C (78°F) for cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> table row: Table data
input: What is the data for the twentieth row of the table?
output: \\textttiv1[3] & \\textttiv2[2] & \\textttiv3[3] & \\textttout[3][2][3]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Where can the CoilSystem:Cooling:DX object be placed?
output: The CoilSystem:Cooling:DX object can also be placed on dedicated outdoor air system (DOAS) airloop branches or in airloop branches where the air flow to capacity ratio range is between 100 300 cfm/ton.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Air Mass Flow Exponent field?
output: The Air Mass Flow Exponent field is used to input the pressure difference exponent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: How is the effectiveness assumed to be a function of in the 'Cooler Wetbulb Design Effectiveness' field?
output: The model assumes that the effectiveness is a function of flow fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the ratio of initial moisture evaporation rate and steady state latent capacity for Speed 2?
output: 1.5 (dimensionless)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> listing
input: Provide an example of an IDF for ZoneAirContaminantBalance.
output: ZoneAirContaminantBalance  Yes             !- Carbon Dioxide Concentration  Outdoor CO2 Schedule     !- Outdoor Carbon Dioxide Schedule Name  Yes             !- Generic Contaminant Concentration  Generic Contaminant Schedule; !- Outdoor Generic Contaminant Schedule Name

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What does the 'Compressor Ambient Temperature Schedule Name' field specify?
output: This alpha field contains the name of a schedule that defines the ambient air temperature surrounding the heat pump compressor which is used to control the compressor's crankcase heater operation. This field is only used when the compressor location field defined above is specified as 'Schedule' otherwise it should be left blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What are the three options for the tank shape?
output: The three options are: VerticalCylinder HorizontalCylinder and Other.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the output variable for unitary system DX coil speed level?
output: HVACAverageUnitary System DX Coil Speed Level []

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the EMPD Surface Layer Moisture Content?
output: The moisture content u of the fictitious surface layer. The surface layer node is not at the actual surface but is instead at the center of surface layer which has a uniform moisture content. This node is separated from the inside face of the surface by a diffusive resistance as described in the Engineering Reference. Units are kg of water per kg of solid material (e.g. gypsum).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: To which type of transformer do the fields 'Electric Meter <#> Name' apply?
output: These fields apply to a PowerInFromGrid type of transformer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the single independent variable in the 'Beam Heating Capacity Temperature Difference Modification Factor Curve Name'?
output: The single independent variable is the ratio of the current simulation results for the difference between the water and air and the difference at the rating point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What method is used to solve the differential equations governing energy balances on nodes?
output: The system simultaneously solves the differential equations governing the energy balances on the nodes using a numerical method.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: What does the 'Demand Manager Demand Limit Power [W]' represent?
output: The actual demand limit after multiplication by the Demand Limit Safety Fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: For which types of windows is the Frame and Divider Name field used?
output: It is used only for exterior GlassDoors and rectangular exterior Windows i.e. those with OutsideFaceEnvironment = Outdoors.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: When is the 'Natural Convection Vertical Wall Equation User Curve Name' field used?
output: The SurfaceConvectionAlgorithm:UserCurve named in this field is used when the previous field is set to UserCurve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'MaximalCell' option do in the 'Cell Control' field?
output: As many cells as possible will be turned on with flow per cell not dropping below the minimum value specified by the Minimum Water Flow Rate Fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum values for the drape fabric beam-beam solar transmittance?
output: The minimum value is 0.0 and the maximum value is less than 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: For what purpose is the high speed 2017 rated evaporator fan power per volume flow rate value used?
output: This value is only used to calculate the ASHRAE/AHRI standard performance metrics to assist the user in verifying their inputs for modeling this type of equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the unit controlled?
output: The unit is controlled by matching the unit output to the zone demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the default value for 'Slat Infrared Transmittance'?
output: The default value is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What happens if the curve output is outside the optional minimum and maximum curve output limits?
output: No error or warning message is issued if the curve output is outside the range of the optional minimum and maximum curve output limits. Instead the curve manager uses the minimum and maximum curve limits to cap the output of the performance curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text
input: What does the last section of the AirLoopHVAC:DedicatedOutdoorAirSystem specify?
output: The last section lists the number of AirLoopHVAC to be served and names of served AirLoopHVAC objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: What does the 'Loop Circulation Time' field specify?
output: The 'Loop Circulation Time' field specifies the time it takes the fluid to circulate through the entire loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Design Power Sizing Method' field?
output: There are two choices: PowerPerFlow and PowerPerFlowPerPressure.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> listing
input: What is the Speed 1 Energy Input Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name?
output: The Speed 1 Energy Input Ratio Function of Temperature Curve Name is HPACHeatEIRFT Speed 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the unit for 'Window Glazing Diffuse to Diffuse Solar Transmittance'?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the Sequential option for Multiple Surface Control Type entail?
output: The list of fenestration surfaces is controlled individually in the order specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the Field: Inlet Node Name represent?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the pump inlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> table row: Legal Zone Equipment Types (ZoneHVAC:EquipmentList)
input: What is one of the legal zone equipment types listed in the table?
output: ZoneHVAC:UnitVentilator

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the intent of the 'GeometryTransform' object?
output: The intent is to provide a single parameter that can be used to reshape the building description contained in the rest of the input file.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What are the choices for the Field: Cooling Coil Object Type?
output: The choices are Coil:Cooling:Water and Coil:Cooling:Water:DetailedGeometry. In other words the unit must use only the water cooling coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the minimum primary air flow fraction?
output: The minimum volumetric air flow rate of primary air through the unit expressed as a fraction of the maximum volumetric air flow rate of primary air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> table row: Heating Design Capacity Method
input: What is the heating design capacity method?
output: Heating Design Capacity Per Floor Area

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: When is Fan:OnOff used?
output: Fan:OnOff is used when the fan cycles on and off with the cooling or heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is contained in the field 'Name'?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the variable speed cooling tower model coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the cooling capacity function of temperature curve name?
output: ExhAbsorb_EIRFt

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the purpose of the upper temperature limit for ventilation?
output: This upper temperature limit is intended to avoid overheating a space and thus result in a cooling load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: How is the priority of availability managers determined?
output: The priority of availability managers is based on a set of rules specific to the type of loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What type of heat exchanger is used?
output: The heat exchanger type is Rotary.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Using EnergyPlus as a Library -> text
input: What did the interface have to do after EnergyPlus completed?
output: The interface just had to wait until EnergyPlus completed check data in the output files and decide what to do next.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What happens if the 'Construction Name' is not found among the constructions on the input file?
output: The Window Data File will be searched for that Construction Name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What do the outputs 'Inverter AC Output Electricity Rate' and 'Inverter AC Output Electricity Energy' represent?
output: These outputs are the total electricity power or energy produced by the inverter which is Alternating Current going out of the inverter.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Node Name' field in the PVT collector?
output: This field is the name of HVAC air loop node that serves as the outlet from the PVT collector. This field is only used if the Thermal Working Fluid Type is set to HVAC/Air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Oil Cooler Inlet Node Name' field represent?
output: This alpha field is used if the oil cooler uses an external cooling loop otherwise the oil cooler will add heat to the ambient conditions (i.e. it is air cooled).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the name of the CoolingTower:SingleSpeed?
output: My Tower

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the output 'Pump Zone Convective Heating Rate [W]' represent?
output: This output is the thermal loss from the pump to the surrounding Zone in the form of convective gains directly to the zone air. It is only available if a Zone was named in the pump input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does e represent in the Colebrook equation?
output: e represents Surface roughness [m].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the 'Coefficient 4 of the Part Load Performance Curve' field specify?
output: This numeric field contains the fourth coefficient (C4) in the part load ratio curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Heating Coil Upper Speed Level variable represent?
output: The Heating Coil Upper Speed Level variable represents the average upper speed level used for interpolating performances between two neighboring speed levels.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the relationship between the zone exhaust node and the terminal unit air inlet node?
output: The zone exhaust node has the same name as the terminal unit air inlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What happens if 'yes' is selected for the 'Do Space Heat Balance for Simulation' field?
output: If yes the space-level heat balance will be calculated and reported during the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Availability Schedule Name' specify?
output: Availability schedule name for this system. Schedule value > 0 means the system is available or else the system is off. If this field is blank the system is always available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the TrackMeter scheme aim to achieve in EnergyPlus?
output: The TrackMeter scheme tries to have the generators meet all the electrical demand from a meter which could also be a user-defined custom meter.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the unit for 'Chiller Heater Cooling Rate' in HVAC output?
output: The unit is Watts [W].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the 'View Factor to Ground' used for?
output: The View Factor to Ground is used to calculate the diffuse solar radiation from the ground that is incident on the surface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> table: Shelter class descriptions
input: What is the description for shelter class 3?
output: Typical shelter caused by other buildings across the street

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What are the minimum and maximum values for w in CoolCapCurve?
output: Minimum: -100 Maximum: 100

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What happens if the 'End-Use Subcategory' field is omitted?
output: If this field is omitted or blank the water heater will be assigned to the 'General' end-use subcategory.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Stack Coefficient' specify?
output: This field specifies the value of the stack coefficient C_s in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the reheat coil air inlet node (fan outlet node)?
output: Zone 3 Reheat Air Inlet Node

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: Is a cooling coil required for a unit ventilator system?
output: No a cooling coil is not a required part of a unit ventilator system. If no cooling coil is present the previous field may be followed by a semi-colon and the remaining parameters in this statement may be ignored.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: ZoneHVAC:ForcedAir:UserDefined -> text
input: How many plant connections can be made to the ZoneHVAC:ForcedAir:UserDefined unit?
output: As many as three different plant connections can be made to the zone unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: Can transmittance be based on the time of day?
output: Yes transmittance can be based on the time of day such as with a movable awning where the transmittance is less than 1.0 when the awning is in place and 1.0 when retracted.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: Why is the second parameter considered important?
output: The second parameter is considered important because changes in temperature difference between supply and return can affect how an air system is controlled to meet the loads.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> table row: Ventilation Load Output Variables
input: What are the columns in the table 'Ventilation Load Output Variables'?
output: The columns in the table are 'No Zone Load' 'Zone Cooling Load' and 'Zone Heating Load'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the Divider Inside Projection used for?
output: It is used to calculate solar absorbed by divider IR emitted and absorbed by divider and convection from divider.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How is electrical efficiency defined in the context of the 'Reference Electrical Efficiency Using Lower Heating Value' field?
output: The electrical efficiency is the electric power output divided by the fuel energy consumption rate (LHV basis).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What type of chiller is the ChillerHeater:Absorption:DoubleEffect?
output: This chiller is an exhaust fired absorption chiller-heater which is modeled using performance curves similar to the direct fired absorption chiller in DOE-2.1E.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What happens if a user is performing a pressure simulation on the loop with this pump?
output: The value would only be used to estimate pump efficiency. During reported calculations the pump would use the loop pressure drop and current flow conditions along with efficiency to calculate pump power dynamically.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What are the two required performance curves for the VRF DX heating coil?
output: The first performance curve defines the heating capacity as a function of indoor air dry-bulb and outdoor condenser entering air dry-bulb or wet-bulb temperature. The second performance curve defines the change in heating capacity as a function of air flow fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text
input: What does the simple building shown in the figure below consist of?
output: The simple building shown in the figure below consists of a controlled zone and a return plenum zone that is used for the return air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'End Year' field?
output: This optional numeric field should contain the end year for the range. It is only allowed to be specified when the Begin Year is given and must be after the Begin Year. If it is not specified it will be set to be the first occurrence of End Month/End Day of Month after the start date.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the rated sensible heat ratio (SHR) of the cooling coil in the unitary system?
output: The rated SHR is 0.75.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What are the valid choices for the method to choose controlled inputs?
output: The valid choices are 'Automatic' and 'User Defined'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> table row: Examples of this object in IDF
input: What is the third example of the 'Shading Zone Group ZoneList Name' object in IDF?
output: ShadowCalculation Scheduled Periodic     Yes;

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text

output: Connections between the air distribution unit the supply air duct and the zone are specified in the input syntax for the air distribution unit and the \\hyperref[airloophvaczonesplitter]AirLoopHVAC:ZoneSplitter.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does the Field: Hydronic Tubing Conductivity specify?
output: It specifies the thermal conductivity of the pipe/tube used in the radiant system in Watts per meter-Kelvin (W/m-K).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: For which defrost types is the defrost energy correction curve name used?
output: The defrost energy correction curve name is used only for the Electric with Temperature Termination Hot-Gas with Temperature Termination and Hot-Brine with Temperature Termination case defrost types.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How can you deploy different shading devices during different time periods for the same window?
output: Specify two different WindowShadingControl objects that both reference the same fenestration with each input object referencing different schedule input objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the list of possible output variables from this coil model?
output: HVAC Average Coil System Water Part Load Ratio [] HVAC Average Coil System Water Total Cooling Rate [W] HVAC Average Coil System Water Sensible Cooling Rate [W] HVAC Average Coil System Water Latent Cooling Rate [W] HVAC Average Coil System Water Control Status []

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Cycling' option do for water flow through the coil?
output: The 'Cycling' option varies water flow through the coil based on the heat pump Part Load Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the minimum runtime if the 'Field: Minimum Runtime Before Operating Mode Change' is not present?
output: The minimum runtime is 0 hours (i.e. immediate change over as needed).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: Why might the output result not correspond to the described values when using output variable frequencies other than detailed?
output: Since the status output is averaged the output result may not correspond to the described values when using output variable frequencies other than detailed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Back Side Beam-Beam Visible Transmittance' represent?
output: The 'Field: Back Side Beam-Beam Visible Transmittance' represents the back side beam-beam visible transmittance of the glazing at normal incidence averaged over the visible spectrum range of solar radiation. It is used only when Optical Data Type = SpectralAverage.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What must the range of the independent variable include for control purposes in the Beam Cooling Capacity Chilled Water Flow Modification Factor Curve Name field?
output: The range of the independent variable must include all the way down to zero flow with zero capacity at zero flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What is the only choice for the 'Control Variable' field in the Return Air Bypass Flow setpoint manager?
output: The only choice for the 'Control Variable' field is Flow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the first step in the operation of multi-cell towers?
output: The first step is to determine the number of cells to operate based on the cell control method -- between the minimum number of cells subject to the maximum water flow rate fraction per cell and maximum number of cells subject to the minimum water flow rate fraction per cell.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Ambient Zone Name field?
output: This field is used to connect ancillary losses from the plant component to a thermal zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the performance curve normalized for the Discharge Only Mode?
output: The performance curve is normalized to have a value of 1.0 at the rating point which is defined to be x = 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When is cold weather protection in effect?
output: Cold weather protection is in effect whenever the outdoor temperature is lower than the limit set in the previous field except when the device is scheduled to not be available by the Availability Schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the Rated Total Heating Power?
output: The Rated Total Heating Power is 200 W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: How do real four pipe induction terminal units differ from the EnergyPlus model in terms of coils?
output: Real units have only a single coil used for both heating and cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: How can uncoated glass visible properties be converted?
output: When alternative optical properties are available such as thickness visible index of refraction and visible extinction coefficient they can be converted to equivalent visible transmittance and reflectance values using the equations given in 'Glass Optical Properties Conversion.'

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the WINDOW program calculate?
output: The WINDOW program calculates the U-value Solar Heat Gain Coefficient solar transmission/absorption characteristics visible transmission characteristics and other properties of a window under standard indoor and outdoor conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What does the 'Maximum Flow Rate' field represent?
output: The design volumetric flow rate of the fan (m³/sec) at standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What should be considered when using Multiplier?
output: Multiplier should be used with caution as Multiplier > 1 can give inaccurate or nonsensical results in situations where the results are sensitive to window or glass door position.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text

output: This numeric field specifies the ancillary electric power consumed by the generator in Watts.

output: If none of the input unit types for Y are appropriate 'Dimensionless' should be selected which will have no unit conversion.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
